title: Market Phases - Accumulation, Markup, Distribution, Markdown
content: Markets move in four phases: 1) Accumulation - Smart money buys while price is flat/low after a downtrend. Volume may increase. 2) Markup - Price trends upward as more buyers enter. This is the best time for long positions. 3) Distribution - Smart money sells to late entrants. Price becomes range-bound at highs. 4) Markdown - Price declines as selling pressure dominates. Short sellers profit. Understanding these phases helps identify where a stock might be in its cycle. Different strategies work better in different phases. Trend-following works in markup/markdown, range trading in accumulation/distribution.
